function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Use of different sensor buses (SPI and I2C) increases complexity and potential for technical failures.","Impact":"Inaccurate data collection and monitoring, leading to incorrect conclusions about indoor air quality and thermal comfort.","Mitigation":"Standardize sensor buses to reduce complexity and improve reliability of data collection.","Technologies":"Standardized sensor bus protocols, such as MODBUS, can be used to streamline sensor communication.","People":"Occupants of the building, facility managers, and maintenance staff.","Owner":"Facility managers, sensor manufacturers."},{"Description":"Variation in sensor precision and accuracy for temperature, humidity, and air quality measurements.","Impact":"Misinterpretation of indoor environmental conditions, leading to ineffective measures to mitigate disease propagation.","Mitigation":"Regular calibration and maintenance schedules for all sensors to ensure accuracy and precision.","Technologies":"Calibration tools and reference standards for temperature, humidity, and air quality sensors.","People":"Occupants of the building, facility managers, and maintenance staff.","Owner":"Facility managers, sensor manufacturers."},{"Description":"Selection of lower-cost sensors for humidity and air quality measurements may compromise data accuracy and reliability.","Impact":"Inaccurate assessment of indoor air quality, leading to potential health risks for building occupants.","Mitigation":"Consider using higher-quality sensors for critical measurements, or implement redundant sensors for validation.","Technologies":"High-precision humidity and air quality sensors with built-in data validation algorithms.","People":"Occupants of the building, facility managers, and maintenance staff.","Owner":"Facility managers, sensor manufacturers."}]}
